results.title: The Vikings
results.creator_credit: Richard Fleischer, Jerry Bresler and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Set in an era rife with bloody raids, gory sword battles and brutal acts of violence, this is the saga of the loves and lusts of the fierce Norse raiders who swept over Europe bringing death and destruction over a thousand years ago. Leading an all-star cast is Kirk Douglas as Einar, hot-blooded, hedonistic son of the Viking chieftain Ragnar (Ernest Borgnine). Years before, Ragnar had molested the British Queen Enid, murdered her husband and left her with child. Enid had secretly sent the baby away to protect the rightful heir from the Viking invaders. Twenty years later, the child grows up to become the proud slave, Eric (Tony Curtis), whose true identity - and love for the Welsh princess Morgana (Janet Leigh) - forces him into an inevitable, climactic showdown with his vicious half-brother, Einar. The authentically staged raids and magnificently filmed panoramas of the Norwegian Fjords and the rugged French coast make this a spectacular and thrilling adventure tale.

results.title: Battle of Britain
results.creator_credit: Guy Hamilton, Harry Saltzman, S Benjamin Fisz Productions and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: This film recreates the greatest air battle in history, when the outnumbered British Royal Airforce battled and fought off the powerful German Luftwaffe at the beginning of World War II. For this film more than 100 vintage aircraft were assembled to re-enact the historic battle in the skies over England. Stars Michael Caine, Trevor Howard, Curt Jurgens, Kenneth More, Ralph Richardson.

results.title: King Solomon's mines
results.creator_credit: Andrew Marton, Compton Bennett, Sam Zimbalist, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer and United Artists Corporation
results.brief_description: Perhaps no film in history has ever captured the languid and treacherous beauty of the jungle as has this shot on location spectacular based on H. Rider Haggard’s colossal tale. Stewart Granger, Deborah Kerr and Richard Carlson are thoroughly convincing as three adventurers on a perilous quest in the wilds of darkest Africa. At her beguiling best, Deborah Kerr plays a prim English lady whose husband has vanished into the jungle while searching for the legendary mines of King Solomon. Stewart Granger’s portrayal of Allan Quartermain, “white hunter” and reluctant leader of the danger fraught expedition, is one of the finest roles of his swashbuckling career. “King Solomon’s Mines” offers a colourful palette of action, danger, suspense, drama and romance. Particularly exciting are the extraordinary animal stampedes captured by Robert Sutees’ Oscar winning cinematography.

results.title: Murder most foul
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Ben Arbeid and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Based upon the novel “Mrs. McGinty’s Dead” by Agatha Christie. Juror Miss Marple refuses to return a guilty verdict and initiates her own murder investigation backstage at a third-rate repertory company. A village baffler brimming with red herrings and tangled motives. Starring Margaret Rutherford and Ron Moody.

results.title: 'Murder ahoy'
results.creator_credit: George Pollock, Lawrence P. Bachmann and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: A sea-going whodunit where the intrepid Miss Marple finds herself investigating events on the HMS Battledore, a navy training ship designed to give young hoodlums a chance at new lives. Miss Marple discovers some-one is training the delinquents to be good thieves instead of good citizens and is willing to kill to keep the fact quiet! Murder Ahoy features a rogues gallery of suspects and ingenious means of despatching victims including strychnine-laced snuff, a poisoned mousetrap and a noose from a yard-arm. Starring Margaret Rutherford, Lionel Jeffries and Stringer Davis.

results.title: Knights of the Round Table
results.creator_credit: Richard Thorpe, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description:
Based on Sir Thomas Malory’s “Le Morte D’Arthur”, this is a tale of chivalry, honour, tragic love and intrigue. At the famous Round Table, established by Arthur to uphold peace, justice and chivalry, sits the gallant Lancelot, Percival and the evil Modred, consort to Arthur’s half-sister, Morgan Le Fay, who is determined to snatch the crown and bring chaos to the realm. The powerful Merlin can do nothing to circumvent the futile love between Lancelot and Queen Guinevere, the consequences of which will not only split the kingdom, but destroy the friendship between the King and his most trusted Knight. All the pageantry and splendour of the age are here.
Cast includes: Robert Taylor, Ava Gardner, Mel Ferrer, Anne Crawford, Stanley Baker and Felix Aylmer.

results.title: The Three musketeers
results.creator_credit: George Sidney, Pandro S. Berman and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: The third talkie version of Alexander Dumas famed story of D’Artagnan - a young man seeking his fortune in 17th Century France. MGM created a splashy production with an all-star cast for this swashbuckling adventure movie, filmed in Technicolor. Gene Kelly gives the impression of having a fabulous time playing the title role of a young anti-authoritarian upstart, a talented swordsman with an eye for attractive ladies of the Court. D’Artagnan joins the three musketeers, Athos, Porthos and Aramis, in order to save their beleageared queen from disgrace. To do so they much face the Machiavellian Milady De Winter and Richelieu. The film, a curious mix of melodrama and burlesque, was one of the top earning films of 1948.

results.title: Agonia = Agony
results.creator_credit: Elem Klimov, Semion Kutikov and Mosfilm
results.brief_description:
In the final days of the Romanov regime (1613-1917), the ‘mad monk’ Rasputin wields power at the court. He is portrayed as a man completely out of touch with the people and political reality, immersed in sexual decadence and the lascivious manipulation of others. The relationship of Rasputin, the Czar and the Empress are explored in this historical drama, with the latter two falling under Rasputin’s spell. Klimov takes a docu-drama approach mixing colour re-enactments of historical events with simulated black and white newsreel footage. This film was completed in 1975 but due to its sympathetic portrayal of Czar Nicholas II, was not released until 1981

Credits: Producer, Semion Kutikov ; director, Elem Klimov ; writer, Semyon Lungin, Ilya Nusinov ; photography, Leonid Kalashnikov ; music, Alfred Shnitke.
Cast: Velta Linei, Alisa Freindlikh, Anatoly Romashin, Alexey Petrenko, A. Romantsov, S. Muchenikov.

results.title: Little Lord Fauntleroy
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell and David O. Selznick
results.brief_description: Cedric is a spoilt child brought up in Brooklyn in the 1880’s who inherits an English title and finds his life transformed. In his stately family home in England, Cedric wins over his stern grandfather (C. Aubrey Smith). Freddie Bartholomew stars in the title role and is well supported by Dolores Costello as his mother and Mickey Rooney as the bootblack.

results.title: Of human bondage. Rain
results.creator_credit: John Cromwell, Lewis Milestone, Joseph Schenck, Pandro S. Berman, Art Cinema Corporation, RKO Radio Pictures and United Artists
results.brief_description: Two Somerset Maugham novels, which became classic films are here presented on one video. In “Of human bondage” Bette Davis made her name as a cheap and vulgar cafe waitress who taunts and ridicules a besotted Leslie Howard, as a crippled professor. Joan Crawford stars in “Rain” as the bad girl Sadie Thompson who attracts the fanatic obsessions of a missionary, which leads to her spiritual reformation. Set during an epidemic on South Sea Pago Pago island, the film caused much controversy on its release.
